text: What is Anti-Unification in first-order logic?
choices: Finding the most general generalization common to two given expressions
Finding the most specific generalization common to two given expressions
Finding the least general generalization common to two given expressions
Finding the most specific generalization common to two unrelated expressions

text: Anti-Unification is used in which area of computer science?
Find the anti-unification of the following first-order language statements:
Find the anti-unification of the following first-order language statements:
body:
fn1(x) ∧ fn2(x) → fn3(x)
fn1(x) ∧ fn2(x) → fn91(x)

Given the following statements, what should replace the question mark in the figure?
body:
P(A) ∧ L(B) ∨ G(C)
P(A) ∧ L(B) → G(C)

text: What should replace {v1} in the figure in each statement to retrieve the original ones?
What is the anti-unification of these statements?
body:
∀x ∃y ∀z P(x, y, z)
∀z ∃y ∀x P(z, y, x)
∀y ∃z ∀x P(y, z, x)

text: What is the anti-unification of these statements?
body:
∀x ∃y ∀z ∃w[P(x, y, z) ∧ Q(y, z, w) ∨ R(x, w)]
∀a ∃b ∀c ∃d [P(a, b, c) ∧ Q(b, c, d) ∨ S(a, d)]
choices: ∀x ∃y ∀z ∃w P(x, y, z) ∧ Q(y, z, w) ∨ S(x, w)
